thread.title: Lawsuit says new L.A. streets plan creates more air pollution, not less
thread.title_full: Lawsuit says new L.A. streets plan creates more air pollution, not less

title: Lawsuit says new L.A. streets plan creates more air pollution, not less
text:
10 Lawsuit says new L.A. streets plan creates more air pollution, not less 
Los Angeles Times: A Westside-based advocacy group filed a lawsuit Wednesday challenging Los Angelesâ€™ sweeping new 20-year transportation plan, saying officials failed to properly vet its effects on public safety, air pollution and other aspects of city life.The nonprofit group Fix the City said in its lawsuit that Mobility Plan 2035, which calls for the addition of hundreds of miles of new bus- and bike-only lanes, will lead to increased tailpipe emissions as drivers find themselves on streets with fewer car lanes and greater congestion.
